chapter.title: Version Control with Git
chapter.para: This chapter is not a Git Tutorial. It focuses on the integration of Git with &SYS_PRODUCT_NAME; and how to use it in an optimal way in this context. If you are not familiar with Git we warmly advise you to first read some of the documents listed in the references section (see ).

section.title: Git support overview in Codendi
Git Plugin Configuration
section.para: On plugin administration page, once the plugin is installed and available. One can change the git backup directory.

Git support is installed as a plugin in the Codendi platform. It has been designed to support multiple repositories for a given project. This is consistent with the Distributed Version Control System philosophy which allows to delegate project features to be developped in separated repositories.
section.title: Repository types
section.para: Two types of repositories are available:

listitem.para: Reference : It is considered as a independant subproject or project module which can be forked
Fork (clone) : It is the result of the 'git clone' command to seperate features works among developement team(s). Could be used as a shared developper's repository

section.para: A reference can be created by project admin from the Git service home page, a reference name can be like reference-project_1.

A reference must be initialized
cd mysources git init git add . git commit -m 'initial commit' git push USER@SERVER:/var/lib/codendi/gitroot/PROJECT_SHORT_NAME/REPO_NAME.git master

section.title: Forking
section.para: Any repository can be forked by any project members. It inherits access from its parent.

section.title: Repository settings (project admin only)
section.para: Several settings are displayed and some can be modified only by project admin.
Access can be changed public (everyone can read/write), private (only project members can read/write).

section.title: Repository deletion (project admin only)
section.para: A repository can be deleted, this will create a backup named after {PROJECT_SHORT_NAME}_{REPOSITORY_NAME}_{DEL_TIMESTAMP}.tar.bz2 and move it into Git Plugin backup directory (see ). See import repository section for backup reactivation.

section.title: Importing an existing Git Repository
section.para: There is no automatic procedure to perform repository import. Read administration guide related section here.
